title: Ticket #3834: DAG hung at LIGO
description:
See the "Socket between submit and execute hosts closed unexpectedly" emails on the LIGO list, starting July 24, 2013.

Note: at first glance, I'm not sure whether this is really a DAGMan problem or a problem in some other part of HTCondor.
remarks:
2013-Aug-07 17:06:35 by wenger:
Okay, here's the problem: 

  07/24/13 06:45:45 Number of idle job procs: 22
  07/24/13 06:45:45 Of 2236 nodes total:
  07/24/13 06:45:45  Done     Pre   Queued    Post   Ready   Un-Ready   Failed
  07/24/13 06:45:45   ===     ===      ===     ===     ===        ===      ===
  07/24/13 06:45:45  1363       0        0       0     250        609       14

Note that 22 jobs procs are supposedly idle when there are no jobs in the queue!!

The idle count clearly got goofed up somehow. I'll try to figure that out, but I'm also thinking that, as a failsafe, when the number of queued jobs hits 0, we should also set the number of idle job procs to 0. (Note that the idle count is job procs, not just jobs, so it is possible for the idle count to be greater than the "jobs in the queue" count.)

2013-Aug-07 17:36:22 by wenger:
Ah, here's the problem: 

  07/23/13 11:02:17 Number of idle job procs: 16
  07/23/13 11:02:17 Event: ULOG_JOB_TERMINATED for Condor Node 9565424f3cb7e9e7af84554e3e30f4a1 (3577562.0.0)
  07/23/13 11:02:17 Number of idle job procs: 16
  07/23/13 11:02:17 Event: ULOG_SHADOW_EXCEPTION for Condor Node 9565424f3cb7e9e7af84554e3e30f4a1 (3577562.0.0)
  07/23/13 11:02:17 Number of idle job procs: 17

We get the shadow exception after the terminated event, which goofs things up because we still increment the idle count... So when we get an event that would normally mark a job as idle, we need to make sure the job hasn't already finished!

2013-Aug-13 10:22:36 by jfrey:
Code Review

This change looks good.

2013-Aug-13 13:31:11 by wenger:
Fixes have been merged to V8_0-branch and master, so I'm going to resolve this.
